body: You mean scoring predictions against expected outputs?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57290644/79880596-d2496000-8422-11ea-8ab3-8fd7411ebfa7.png)

 I attached the images, it is one of the method inside the GMM Sklearn model. 
I already tried to changed the option using this code:
options = {id(models): {'raw_scores': True}}

But I still couldn't found the score yet.
Thank you
Sorry for my previous reply, it was irrelevant. It is not implemented but it should not be too difficult. Do you prefer a third output or to replace the probabilities by scoring?
I prefer third output, but since I still not used probabilities, replace the probabilities also okay. Thank you.

@xadupre Hi sorry, I just want to clarify, so the .score_samples method is still not yet implemented for this version that mean that I still couldn't use it for now? If not yet implemented, how long the development of this method? Or I can use another way like custom pipeline or something? Thank you very much for your help.

It is not implemented yet. The convert the score method needs to be converted into ONNX whatever the solution you choose. I plan to work on it. It should be ready by end of week. Let me know if that's not ok for you.

Wow that's great, thank you very much really appreciate it. It will be really mean for me if I could use it by this week or next week. Really need it soon, anyway thank you very much. This Onnx-Sklearn library already helps me a lot especially when I need to use my python model in unity. @xadupre
Related PR #432, I still need to fix some discrepencies.

@xadupre Thank you for your changes to the code, but I found some error, here is the error when I run the session from onnxruntime after converting the model.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57290644/80056906-e9d63500-8557-11ea-8a40-be9ea53e5e42.png)
Which version of onnxruntime are you using? I'll continue working on this today.
I am using version 1.2.0 for OnnxRuntime, but it runs well if I didn't put options when converting my model.
I used the nightly build and this error is now a warning (but I still need to remove it).
Thank you very much @xadupre. It's worked as expected. Really appreciate your help

issue.title: IsolationForest missing access to score_samples() method

repository.name: sklearn-onnx
repository.description: Convert scikit-learn models and pipelines to ONNX

issue.body:
Similar to #431, it would be helpful to get the anomaly scores from in addition to the prediction.

```
if_smtp_types = [('float_input', FloatTensorType([None, len(cols)]))] # our input is the number of columns and they are all floats
options = {id(classifier): {'score_samples': True}}
onx_score = convert_sklearn(classifier, initial_types=if_smtp_types, options=options)
with open("smtp_if_score.onnx", "wb") as f:
    f.write(onx_score.SerializeToString())
```

Here `classifier` is a trained `sklearn.ensemble.IsolationForest()`.

I get the following error:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
NameError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-73-1f4325848ac6> in <module>
      3 if_smtp_types = [('float_input', FloatTensorType([None, len(cols)]))] # our input is the number of columns and they are all floats
      4 options = {id(classifier): {'score_samples': True}}
----> 5 onx_score = convert_sklearn(classifier, initial_types=if_smtp_types, options=options)
      6 with open("smtp_if_score.onnx", "wb") as f:
      7     f.write(onx_score.SerializeToString())

~/local/anaconda3/envs/pecoc_boto/lib/python3.8/site-packages/skl2onnx/convert.py in convert_sklearn(model, name, initial_types, doc_string, target_opset, custom_conversion_functions, custom_shape_calculators, custom_parsers, options, intermediate, white_op, black_op, final_types, dtype, verbose)
    160     if verbose >= 1:
    161         print("[convert_sklearn] convert_topology")
--> 162     onnx_model = convert_topology(topology, name, doc_string, target_opset,
    163                                   options=options,
    164                                   remove_identity=not intermediate,

~/local/anaconda3/envs/pecoc_boto/lib/python3.8/site-packages/skl2onnx/common/_topology.py in convert_topology(topology, model_name, doc_string, target_opset, channel_first_inputs, options, remove_identity, verbose)
   1199                     "".format(operator.type,
   1200                               type(getattr(operator, 'raw_model', None))))
-> 1201         container.validate_options(operator)
   1202         conv(scope, operator, container)
   1203 

~/local/anaconda3/envs/pecoc_boto/lib/python3.8/site-packages/skl2onnx/common/_container.py in validate_options(self, operator)
    664         """
    665         skl_op = operator.raw_operator
--> 666         self.get_options(skl_op)
    667 
    668     def get_options(self, model, default_values=None, fail=True):

~/local/anaconda3/envs/pecoc_boto/lib/python3.8/site-packages/skl2onnx/common/_container.py in get_options(self, model, default_values, fail)
    676         :return: dictionary
    677         """
--> 678         return _build_options(

     66             if k not in allowed_options:

---> 68                     raise NameError(
     69                         "Option '{}' not in {} for class '{}'.".format(
     70                             k, list(sorted(allowed_options)),

NameError: Option 'score_samples' not in [] for class 'IsolationForest'.
```
